japanese: ５人の囚人は捕まったが、残り３人は今も逃走中だ。

english: In case you go out before 5, just let me know.

english: He'll be back by five o'clock.

english: I'd like to get home by five.

english: Do you think it impossible to finish the task before five?

english: I want to finish this work by five.

japanese: ５時までにこの仕事を終わらせたい。

english: Please wait till five, when he'll be back.

japanese: ５時に駅で会うことになっている。
english: I am to meet him at five at the station.

english: Could you arrange to be here at five?

japanese: ５時にお電話下さいませんか。
english: Would you please call me up at five o'clock?

english: There is no admission fee for children under five.

japanese: ５歳の時は、バスの運転手になりたかった。
english: I wanted to be a bus driver when I was five.

english: May comes after April.

english: In May the trees have fresh leaves.

japanese: ５月でさえとても寒い。
english: It's even very cold in May.

english: The doctor can see you at ten on May seventh.

english: The 5th May is Children's Day.

english: Would you please meet me at Yaesu central gate of Tokyo Station on Monday, May 10th at 3:00 p.m.?

english: Please cancel my reservation on JAL flight two to New York on May 10.

japanese: 五階へはエレベーターで行きなさい。
english: Take the elevator to the fifth floor.

english: Take the elevator to the fifth floor.

english: Take the elevator to the fifth floor.

japanese: エレベータで５階まで来てください。

japanese: ５マイルは歩くには長い距離だ。

english: 5 is less than 8.

english: Four times five is twenty.

english: Here's $5.

japanese: ５ドルぐらいしか持ち合わせがない。
english: I have little more than 5 dollars.

english: Add 5 and 2, and you get 7.

english: He died aged 54 years.

english: Compared to fifty years ago, today's aviation technology has made great progress.

english: Fifty years ago anyone could have bought the land.

english: This is the hottest summer we have had in fifty years.

japanese: ５０セントしかくれなかった。

japanese: ５０人もの乗客が死んだ。

japanese: ５０人もの乗客がその事故でけがをした。
english: No less than fifty passengers were injured in the traffic accident.

japanese: ５０歳は超えているはずだ。

english: Write in less than 50 words.

japanese: ５０円です。

english: Follow the street for about 50 meters, and you will see a post office.

english: Five hundred dollars is a small sum for him.

english: For four years, he cut the grass at the original price, but I noticed that toward the end of that year, he had a helper with him quite often.

japanese: ４人の少年たちが道を歩いている。

japanese: ４掛ける２は８だ。

english: Four hundred million people speak English as their first language.

english: The following is what he started to think, as he made his way to room 418.

english: We ordered 40 minutes ago.

japanese: ４０近いはずだ。

english: Bear in mind that half one's life is lived after forty.

japanese: ４００語以上書く必要はない。
english: You need not write more than 400 words.

japanese: ４０％以上の生徒が大学に進学する。
english: More than 40 percent of the students go to university.

japanese: ４０％もの生徒が大学に進学する。
english: No less than 40 percent of students go on to university.

japanese: ３歩歩いてジャンプしなさい。
english: Take three steps and jump.

japanese: ３分の２の学生が学生大会に欠席した理由がわかりますか。
english: Do you know the reason why two-thirds of the students did not attend the student meeting?

japanese: ３分たったら教えてもらえますか。
english: Will you notify me after 3 minutes?

english: The third star belonged to a certain king.

japanese: ３番目に考慮すべき事柄は、カーペットの時代性である。
english: The age of the carpet is a third thing to consider.

japanese: ３年前死産しました。
english: I had a stillborn baby three years ago.

japanese: 三年前に東京に来てから、ここに住んでいます。
english: I came to Tokyo three years ago and have been living here ever since.

japanese: ３年後に戦争が始まった。
english: The war began three years later.

japanese: ３年ぶりに平和が戻った。
english: Peace has returned after three years of war.

japanese: ３年というのは長い時間だと私は思う。
english: Three years is a long time, I feel.

japanese: 三日続きの雨だった。
english: It rained three days on end.

english: It rained three days on end.

japanese: ３日続けて雨が降った。
english: It rained three days on end.

english: Please come in three days.

japanese: ３日後になってはじめて彼女が失踪したことを知った。
english: It was not until three days after that I knew she had disappeared.

japanese: ３日間雨が降り続いている。
english: It has rained for three days on end.

japanese: ３日間そこに滞在した。
english: He stayed there for three days.

japanese: ３日以内に返事します。
english: I will answer within three days.

japanese: 三日以内にお返事いたします。
english: I will answer within three days.

japanese: ３日ほどの旅行と見ておきましょう。
english: Let's make it about a three-day trip.

japanese: ３日たってから返事が来た。
english: The reply came after three days.

japanese: 返事は三日後に来た。
english: The reply came after three days.

japanese: ３対１で負けた。
english: We lost by a score of three to one.

japanese: ３対１でこっちが負けた。
english: We lost by a score of three to one.

japanese: ３対０で彼には負けています。
english: He's beating me, three to zip.

japanese: ３隻の船が女王から彼に与えられた。
english: Three ships were given to him by the queen.

japanese: ３世紀前においてさえも、ほとんどの西ヨーロッパ人はまだ指を使っていた。
english: Even three centuries ago, most Western Europeans still used their fingers.

japanese: ３人組が白昼その銀行を襲った。
english: A gang of three robbed the bank in broad daylight.

japanese: ３人組の男が彼をナイフで脅した。
english: Three men menaced him with knives.

japanese: ３人は合わせて５０ポンド持っていた。
english: The three men had £50 between them.

japanese: ３人はそれぞれ違った３通りの事故の説明をした。
english: The three people gave three different accounts of the accident.

japanese: ３人はお互いに憎み合っていた。
english: All three hated one another.

japanese: ３人の隣人はお互いに助け合った。
english: The three neighbours helped each other.

japanese: ３人の中国人留学生がその大学に入学が許された。
english: Three Chinese students were admitted to the college.

japanese: ３人の男性がいた。
english: There were three men.

japanese: 男が三人いた。
english: There were three men.

japanese: ３人の男が昨日脱獄した。
english: Three men broke out of prison yesterday.

japanese: ３人の大男が彼を攻撃して彼のお金を盗んだ。
english: Three big men attacked him and stole his money.

japanese: ３人の赤ん坊が泣きやまなくて、頭が痛くなってきた。
english: Three babies crying incessantly gave me a headache.

japanese: ３人の生徒が短いスピーチを言い、自己紹介をしたり自分の国について話した。
english: Three students made short speeches and introduced themselves and their countries.

japanese: 3人の生徒が簡単に挨拶をして、自分自身や自分の国のことを紹介した。
english: Three students made short speeches and introduced themselves and their countries.

japanese: ３人の少年達はその建物の扉を開けました。
english: The three boys opened the doors of the building.

japanese: ３人の少年はさながら猿のように木に登った。
english: Three boys climbed the trees like a bunch of monkeys.

japanese: ３人の子供が公園で遊んでいた。
english: Three children were playing in the park.

japanese: ３人の少年たちはめいめい賞を得た。
english: Each of the three boys won a prize.

japanese: ３人の候補者が大統領に立候補して、彼が選ばれた。
english: Three candidates ran for President and he was elected.

japanese: ３人の子供がソファーに座った。
english: Three children sat on the sofa.

japanese: ３人の看護婦が四六時中瀕死の大臣の看護に当たった。
english: Three nurses attended the dying minister night and day.

english: While one of them sped around major parts of the property on the mower, a second made a few sweeps at some tall weeds on the edge of my wife's garden, and the third got into the truck and smoked a cigarette.

english: Who runs the fastest of the three?

japanese: ３人のうちで私が一番年上です。
english: I am the oldest of the three.

japanese: 私は三人組の中で最年長だ。
english: I am the oldest of the three.

japanese: ３人のうちで最年少の少年が一番魅力的だ。
english: Of the three boys, the youngest is the most attractive.

japanese: ３人にはこの食事で十分だ。
english: This meal is adequate for three.

japanese: ３人が依然行方不明です。
english: Three people are still missing.

japanese: ３週間仕事を探して、やっと給料のよい仕事を見つけた。

english: An orphan at three, he was brought up by a distant relative.

japanese: ２人の間に愛が芽生えた。

japanese: 二週間後に帰ってきます。
english: I will be back in two weeks' time.

japanese: ２週間が過ぎた。

japanese: ２社は合併を計画している。
english: The two companies plan to unite.

japanese: ２社が互いに競争している。
english: The two companies are competing with each other.

english: The two companies are competing with each other.

japanese: ２時間後に戻ります。
english: I'll be back in two hours.

english: How about the one which starts two hours later?

japanese: ２時間も待たされた。

japanese: ２時間ほど前から雷雨のため連絡が断たれている。

japanese: ２時間しか寝なかった。眠いのは当然だ。
english: I slept only two hours. No wonder I'm sleepy.

japanese: ２時の飛行機に乗り遅れた。
english: I missed the two o'clock plane.

japanese: ２時に遅い昼食をとった。
english: We had a late lunch at two.

japanese: ２時に出発したら、６時にはつくはずだ。
english: If they started at two, they should arrive at six.

japanese: ２時に空港に見送りに行きます。
english: I'm going to see her off at the airport at 2:00.

japanese: ２時に医者の予約をした。
english: I made a doctor's appointment for two.

japanese: 医者の予約を二時に入れた。
english: I made a doctor's appointment for two.

japanese: ２時でいい？
english: Would two o'clock be all right?

japanese: ２時からずっと続けて書いている。
english: I have been writing since two o'clock without a break.

japanese: ２時からずっと君を待っている。
english: I've been waiting for you since two o'clock.

japanese: ２歳の娘の健康診断をお願いします。
english: I'd like to get a medical examination for my two-year-old daughter.

japanese: ２歳の子どもがそんなに速く走れるだろうか。
english: Can a two-year-old boy run that fast?

japanese: ２国間の貿易上のアンバランスを改善しなければならない。
english: The trade imbalance between two nations should be improved.

japanese: ２軒の家の間の道は雪で閉ざされていた。
english: The path between the two houses was blocked by snow.

japanese: ２軒の家が並んでたっている。
english: The two houses stand alongside of each other.

japanese: ２軒の家がその火事で全焼した。
english: Two houses were burned down in the fire.

japanese: ２月２７日の約束についてですが、申し訳ありませんが、私の出張スケジュールが変更になったため、その日にお会いすることができなくなりました。
english: With regard to our appointment on February 27, I regret to inform you that I will not be able to keep it because my business trip schedule has been changed.

japanese: ２月２７日の弊社でのミーティングについて下記のご確認させて下さい。
english: I would like to confirm the following for our meeting at our office on February 27.

japanese: ２月２７日の三時から１時間くらい会うことにしませんか。
english: Could we see each other for about an hour on February 27 at 3:00 p.m.?

japanese: ２月２７日の午後はずっと空いています。
english: I am free all afternoon on February 27.

japanese: ２月２７日（月曜日）のお約束の確認ですが、午前１０時に貴社にお伺いするということでしたね。
english: This is to confirm the appointment we made to meet at your office at 10:00 am on Monday, February 27th.

japanese: ２月１５日に受け取るはずだった商品をまだ受け取っていません。
english: I have not received the goods scheduled for arrival here on February 15.

japanese: ２桁のＩＱがある人間なら誰でも、この選択が政治的に偏ったものだって分かってるよ。
english: Anybody with at least a two-digit IQ knows this was a politically biased choice.

japanese: ２月１４日、アメリカ人はバレンタインデーを祝う。
english: On February 14 Americans celebrate St. Valentine's Day.

japanese: ２階へ上がると赤城山がよく見える。
english: There's a good view of Mt. Akagi from upstairs.

japanese: ２階へいって私のトランクを持ってきてくれ。
english: Go upstairs and bring down my trunk.

japanese: ２階へ行って寝なさい。
english: Go upstairs and go to bed.

japanese: ２階の誰かがやっているパーティーのおかげで、昨晩は夜の一時まで眠れなかったんだ。
english: Some kind of party upstairs kept me up till one last night.

japanese: ２階に予備の部屋が二部屋ありますが、そのどちらもここ数年使用されていません。
english: We have two spare rooms upstairs, neither of which has been used for years.

japanese: 二階からトランクを降ろしてくれませんか。
english: Can you bring down my trunk from upstairs?

japanese: ２階からトランクを降ろしてきてくれませんか。
english: Can you bring down my trunk from upstairs?

japanese: ２階で朝早い時間に警報器が鳴っているのが聞こえた。
english: The alarm was heard ringing at an early hour on the second floor.

japanese: ２マイル上流に橋がかかっている。
english: There is a bridge two miles upstream.

japanese: ２マイルぐらいあります。
english: It's about two miles.

japanese: 約３．２キロです。
english: It's about two miles.

japanese: ２ブロック先まで歩き、左へ曲がりなさい。
english: Walk two blocks, and turn left.

japanese: ４は日本語では縁起の悪い数字だ。
english: Four is an unlucky number in Japanese.

japanese: ２パイントは１クオートと等しい。
english: Two pints are equal to a quart.

japanese: ２は１６の４乗根です。
english: Two is the fourth root of sixteen.

japanese: ２の２倍は４です。
english: Twice two is four.

japanese: ２と３と４の合計は９だ。
english: The sum of two plus three plus four is nine.

japanese: ２つ目の角を右に曲がりなさい。
english: Turn right at the second corner.

japanese: ２つの問題が未解決のままであった。
english: Two problems remained unsolved.

japanese: ２つの物語のうち、後の方が良い。
english: Of the two stories, the latter story is better.

japanese: ２つの物の間にはごくわずかな差しかない。
english: There is only a marginal difference between the two.

japanese: ２つの派閥が手をむすんだ。
english: The two factions gang up with each other.

japanese: ２つの土手の間に、むかし橋がかかっていた。
english: There used to be a bridge between two river banks.

japanese: ２つの質問をしてもよいですか。
english: May I ask a couple of questions?

japanese: 二つ質問してもいいですか。
english: May I ask a couple of questions?

japanese: ２つの組は合併されて大人数のクラスになった。
english: The two classes were brought together into a larger class.

japanese: ２つの国は１つの政府に統合された。
english: The two countries were united under one government.

japanese: ２つの構文の間に意味の相違はないように思われる。
english: There does not seem to be any difference of meaning between the two constructions.

japanese: ２つの構文には意味の違いは何も無いようだ。
english: There doesn't seem any difference of meaning between the two constructions.

japanese: ２つの間には重要なつながりがある。
english: There's a vital link between the two.

japanese: ２つの画像がダブってしまった。
english: Two pictures were doubled.

japanese: ２つの家族が同じ家に住んでいる。
english: Two families live in the same house.

japanese: ２つの意見に大した差はない。
english: There is not much difference between the two opinions.

japanese: ２つのことを同時にすることができる人はいない。
english: Nobody can do two things at once.

japanese: ２つのグループが団結して１つの政党になった。
english: Two groups united to form a party.

japanese: ２つのクラブは合併して１つになった。
english: The two clubs united to form one.

japanese: ２つのキャブレターを装備したことで、そのレーシング狂はエンジンをすこぶる強力にした。
english: By installing two carburetors that racing-car enthusiast souped up his motor considerably.

japanese: ２つのうちどちらが美しいかが彼女にとっては大問題だった。
english: It was very important to her which was the more beautiful of the two.

japanese: ２つのうちどちらかを選びなさい。
english: Choose either one or the other.

japanese: ２チームは決勝戦で競った。
english: The two teams competed in the final game.

japanese: ２ヶ月分の敷金を入れていただきます。
english: Please pay a deposit of two month's rent.

japanese: ２ヶ月に１度メーターを検査します。
english: We read the meter once every two months.

japanese: ２か月前にむち打ち症をやりました。
english: I had a whiplash injury two months ago.

japanese: ２５歳までに、彼女は五つの異なる国で暮らしてきた。
english: By the age of 25, she had lived in five different countries.

japanese: ２５セント硬貨をお持ちですか。
english: Do you have any quarters?

japanese: ２５号線北方面の入り口付近にいます。
english: I'm near the on ramp to 25 north.

japanese: ２５セント硬貨２０枚、残りは１０セント硬貨でください。
english: Give me 20 quarters and the rest in dimes.

japanese: ２５０キロというのは相撲取りとしても並外れた体重だ。
english: Two hundred fifty kilograms is an extraordinary weight even for a sumo wrestler.

japanese: ２４時間営業ですか。
english: Is it open round the clock?

japanese: ２２ページの一節を読んで下さい。
english: Read the passage on page 22, please.

japanese: ２２６便は１０時３０分に離陸します。
english: Flight 226 takes off at 10:30.

japanese: ２１世紀は経済力を基盤とするようになるだろう。
english: The 21st century is going to be based on economic power.

japanese: ２１世紀はほんの数年で始まる。
english: The twenty-first century starts in just a few years.

japanese: ２１世紀はアジアの時代である。
english: The 21st century belongs to Asia.

japanese: ２１世紀がどのようになるか想像できますか。
english: Can you imagine what the 21st century will be like?

japanese: ２１３号室の前でお待ちください。
english: Please wait in front of Room 213.

japanese: ２１２ー８３６ー１７２５に指名通話をかけたいんだけど。
english: I want to make a person-to person call to 212-836-1725.

japanese: ２０分後に電話を掛け直してもいいですか。
english: Can I call you back in twenty minutes?

japanese: ２０分たったらこちらから電話をします。
english: I'll call back in twenty minutes.

japanese: ２０分かそこらで戻ります。
english: I'll be back in twenty minutes or so.

japanese: ２０年とは長い年月だ。
english: Twenty years is a long time.

japanese: ２０日と２１日の午後を空けてありますので、この２日間のいずれかにグラント様とお会いしたいと考えています。
english: I have kept available the afternoon of the 20th and the 21st, and would like to know if Mr Grant will be available for a meeting on either of those two days.

japanese: ２０代の若い女性の中には、夏休みに海外旅行にでたいと思う人も多い。
english: Many young women in their 20s plan to go abroad during their summer holidays.

japanese: 多くの２０代女性は夏休みに海外へ行く計画をする。
english: Many young women in their 20s plan to go abroad during their summer holidays.

japanese: ２０世紀の終わりまでに科学がどこまで進歩しているか、見当もつかない。
english: There is no telling how far science may have progressed by the end of the twentieth century.

japanese: ２０世紀の間に、こうしたことすべてが変わった。
english: In the course of the twentieth century all this changed.

japanese: ２０人の警官が現場に現れた。
english: Twenty police have arrived on the scene.

japanese: ２０周年記念に乾杯。
english: A toast to your 20th Anniversary!

japanese: ２０歳になっていれば、投票できるのに。
english: If I were twenty, I could vote.

japanese: ２０才になるまでタバコを吸ってはいけない。
english: Don't smoke until you're 20 years old.

japanese: ２０才になって初めて、彼女は歌手になろうと決心した。
english: She did not decide to be a singer until she reached the age of twenty.

japanese: ２０軒もの家が焼け落ちた。
english: No less than twenty houses were burnt down.

japanese: ２０以上の注文につきましては、見積りより１０％引きの特別価格でご提供します。
english: For quantities of 20 or more, we can allow you a special discount of 10% on the prices quoted.

japanese: ２０ユニット以上注文したら、値引きしていただけますか。
english: If we place an order for more than 20 units, would you reduce the price?

japanese: ２０マイル先に山の頂上が見えた。
english: We could see the summit of a mountain twenty miles away.

japanese: ２０マイル以内の配達は無料です。
english: We deliver your order free of charge within a 20-mile radius.

japanese: ２０マイルは、歩くのに長い距離だ。
english: Twenty miles is a long distance to walk.

japanese: ２０ほどの問題で意見の一致をみている。
english: Some 20 issues have been agreed on.

japanese: ２０パーセントから４０パーセント値引きされているよ。
english: Prices have been reduced by 20 to 40 percent.

japanese: ２０ドル札をくずせますか。
english: Can you make change for a 20-dollar bill?

japanese: ２０ドル札と、あとそれより少額の札を何枚か入れて下さい。
english: Twenties and some smaller bills, please.

japanese: ２０ドル札３枚、５ドル札６枚、残りを１ドル札でお願いします。
english: I'd like three twenties, six fives, and the rest in ones.

japanese: ２０ドルを３枚、５ドルを６枚、残りを１ドル札でお願いします。
english: I'd like three twenties, six fives, and the rest in ones.

japanese: ２０チームがトーナメントに出場した。
english: Twenty teams entered the tournament.

japanese: ２０３０年までには、全人口の２１パーセントが６５歳を越すようになる。
english: By 2030, twenty-one percent of its population will be over sixty-five.

japanese: ２０２０年までには、この市の人口は倍増しているだろう。
english: By the year 2020, the population of this city will have doubled.

japanese: ２００人の人が昨年コレラで死んだ。
english: Two hundred people died of cholera last year.

japanese: ２００語以内でその文章を要約してください。
english: Sum up the passage within 200 words.

japanese: ２００１年は２１世紀の始まる年です。
english: 2001 is the year when the 21st century begins.

japanese: ２００１年４月１日から授業料が、１０％近く値上げになります。
english: Tuition will be raised by nearly ten percent as of April 1, 2001.

japanese: ２．大根は拍子木に切る。
english: 2. Cut the daikon into long sticks.

japanese: ２、４、６などは偶数です。
english: Two, four, six, etc. are even numbers.

japanese: ２、３分歩いたら海辺に着いた。
english: A few minutes' walk brought me to the shore.

japanese: ２、３分前にトイレに入るのを見たよ。
english: I saw him go into the toilet a few minutes ago.

japanese: 少し時間を割いていただけないでしょうか。
english: Could you spare me a few minutes?

japanese: 少し時間をいただけないでしょうか。
english: Could you spare me a few minutes?

japanese: ２、３分時間を割いていただけませんか。
english: Could you spare me a few minutes?

japanese: ２、３分も歩かないうちに雨が降り出した。
english: I had hardly been walking for a few minutes when it began to rain.

japanese: ２、３分なら時間があります。
english: I have a few minutes to spare.

japanese: ２、３分で歯茎がしびれてきます。
english: Your gums will get numb in a few minutes.

japanese: ２、３分したらそちらにまいります。
english: I'll be with you in a few minutes.

japanese: ２、３年前、私たちの部屋には家具はほとんどなかった。
english: A few years ago, our room had little furniture in it.

japanese: ２、３日滞在を延ばしたいのですが。
english: I want to extend my stay here for a few more days.

japanese: ２、３日前に、彼と駅で会った。
english: I saw him at the station a few days ago.

japanese: ２、３日寝ていなさい。
english: You'd better stay in bed for a few days.

japanese: ２、３日骨休めして。
english: Please take a rest for a few days.

japanese: ２、３日ゆっくりするといいですよ。
english: A few days' rest will do you good.

japanese: ２、３日もすればよくなるよ。
english: It'll pass in a few days.

japanese: ２、３日で東京見物をすることは困難です。
english: It is hard to see the sights of Tokyo in a few days.

japanese: ２、３日たって初めて彼が到着した。
english: It was not until a few days later that he arrived.

japanese: ２、３日そこに滞在した。
english: He stayed there a couple of days.

japanese: ２、３日すれば彼は帰ってくるだろう。
english: He will be back in a few days.

japanese: ２、３日すれば開花するでしょう。
english: The blossoms will be out in a few days.

japanese: ２、３日したら元どおり元気になるよ。
english: You'll be all right again in a couple of days.

japanese: ２、３日お車をお貸しいただけないでしょうか。
english: I wonder if you would mind lending me your car for a couple of days.

japanese: ２、３日おきに電話して。そうすればもしなにか起きても連絡が保てるから。
english: Call me every few days, and in that way we can keep in touch if something happens.

japanese: ２、３度行ったことがある。
english: I've been there a couple of times.

japanese: ２、３人の生徒が取り残された。
english: A few students were left behind.

japanese: ２、３週間もすれば木の葉は紅葉するでしょう。
english: The leaves will turn red in two or three weeks.

japanese: ２、３質問をしてもよろしいですか。
english: May I ask a few questions?

japanese: ２、３時間出血が続きます。
english: You'll have bleeding for a few hours.

japanese: ２、３冊の読むべきいい本を選び出せますか。
english: Can you pick out a few good books to read?

japanese: ２、３の小さな誤りを別にすれば、君の作文は優秀だった。
english: Apart from a few minor mistakes, your composition was excellent.

japanese: ２、３の誤りがあるのを除いては彼の作文は申し分ありません。
english: Except for a few mistakes, his composition is perfect.

japanese: ２、３の欠点を別にすれば、彼は信頼できるパートナーだ。
english: Apart from a few faults, he is a trustworthy partner.

japanese: ２、３ヶ月後、彼らは北極にある繁殖地へと戻っていきます。
english: A few months later they return to their breeding grounds in the Arctic.

japanese: １塁があいていたので打者を歩かせた。
english: With first base open, he walked the batter.

japanese: １万円札を５０ペンス硬貨に両替してくれませんか。
english: Can you exchange a 10000 yen note into 50 pence coins?

japanese: 費用は１万円では上がらないだろう。
english: It will cost more than ten thousand yen.

japanese: １万円以上します。
english: It will cost more than ten thousand yen.

japanese: １万円では足が出る。
english: Ten thousand yen will not cover the expenses.

japanese: １万円でたりる？
english: Will ten thousand yen do?

japanese: １万メートルを走るには大いに耐久力を必要とする。
english: You need great endurance to run ten thousand meters.

japanese: １枚の落ち葉が水面に浮かんでいた。
english: A fallen leaf floated on the surface of the water.

japanese: １枚の枯れ葉が地面に落ちた。
english: A dead leaf fell to the ground.

japanese: １平方メートルの太陽光発電パネルの出力は約１ワットであり、今のところ大規模に太陽電力を利用するのは困難である。
english: The output power of a one square meter solar panel is about one watt, so it is difficult to use solar power on a large scale at present.

japanese: １分歩くか歩かないうちに彼と出会った。
english: I had scarcely walked a minute before I met him.

japanese: １分違いで列車に乗り遅れた。
english: He missed the train by a minute.

japanese: １分待つか待たない内に彼が来た。
english: I had hardly waited a minute when he came.

japanese: １分も無駄にできない。
english: We can ill afford to lose a minute.

japanese: １分だってほぼ４ポンドかかるんだから。
english: Because just one minute costs nearly four pounds.

japanese: １秒にたったの６ペンスよ。
english: It's only six pence per second.

japanese: １匹の猫を別とすれば家は空っぽだった。
english: The house was empty except for a cat.

japanese: １匹のキリギリスと多くのアリが野原に住んでいた。
english: A grasshopper and many ants lived in a field.

japanese: １匹の猫がカーテンの陰から現れた。
english: A cat appeared from behind the curtain.

japanese: １匹のイヌが公園で走っています。
english: A dog is running in the park.

japanese: １晩とめていただけますか。
english: Could you please put me up for the night?

japanese: １泊６０ドルくらいのシングルの部屋を２室、２１日から３泊でお願いします。
english: I'd like two singles for three nights from the 21st for about sixty dollars a night.

japanese: １泊５０ドルのシングルのお部屋がございます。
english: We have a single for 50 dollars per night.

japanese: １泊５０ドルくらいのダブルの部屋を一室、今晩から４泊お願いします。
english: I'd like a double for four nights starting tonight for about fifty dollars a night.

japanese: １杯の熱いスープで私は気分がくつろいだ。
english: A cup of hot soup relaxed me.

japanese: １年無駄に過ごすよりもどの会社でもいいから働きたい。
english: I would rather work for any company than waste another year.

japanese: １年中での楽しい時期です。
english: It is an exciting time of the year.

japanese: １年前に比べれば価格は大きく落ち込んでいる。
english: Compared with the level of a year ago, the price is sharply lower.

japanese: １年前、彼に車の運転ができていたらよかったのに。
english: I wish he could have driven a car a year ago.

japanese: １年間彼女から便りがありません。
english: I have not heard from her for a year.

japanese: １年間の間に息子は頑強になった。
english: In the course of a year my son grew stronger.

japanese: １年以内にあなた方が全員、流暢な英語を話せるようにしてあげます。
english: I'll have you all speaking fluent English within a year.

japanese: １年の最初の季節は春です。
english: The first season of the year is spring.

japanese: １年のこの時期は天候がよく変わる。
english: The weather changes very often at this time of year.

japanese: １年には４つの季節、春、夏、秋、冬がある。
english: There are four seasons in a year: spring, summer, fall and winter.

japanese: １年には季節がいくつありますか。
english: How many seasons are there in a year?

japanese: １年には１２か月あります。
english: A year has twelve months.

japanese: １年は１２ヶ月あります。
english: A year has twelve months.

japanese: 1年は12ヶ月です。
english: A year has twelve months.

japanese: １年たったらあなたが昇給するように取り計らいましょう。
english: I'll see to it that you have a raise after the first year.

japanese: １年が過ぎ、彼の死体は塵と化した。
english: A year had passed by and his body turned to dust.

japanese: １日中憂鬱な気分だった。
english: I was feeling blue all day.

japanese: 一日中ブルーだった。
english: I was feeling blue all day.

japanese: 一日ずっと沈んでいた。
english: I was feeling blue all day.

japanese: １日中歩き回って大変疲れた。
english: I am dead tired from walking around all day.

japanese: 一日中歩き回ってもうくたくただ。
english: I am dead tired from walking around all day.

japanese: １日中働いた後なので、彼らはかなり疲れていた。
english: They were pretty tired after having worked all day.

japanese: １日中雨が降り続いた。
english: It has kept raining all day.

japanese: １日中テニスをしていたのだから。
english: He was playing tennis all day.

japanese: １日中ずっと仕事をしていたから。
english: I've been working all day.

japanese: １日中、ベッドに横たわっていたら、うんざりした。
english: I got tired of lying in bed all day.

japanese: １日遅れます。
english: We are gaining a day.

japanese: １日や２日で東京見物をするのは不可能です。
english: It's impossible to do the sights of Tokyo in a day or two.

japanese: 1日や2日で東京を見て回るなんて出来ない。
english: It's impossible to do the sights of Tokyo in a day or two.

japanese: １日のうちのこの時間、ここはいつも交通量が多いのです。
english: There is always heavy traffic here at this time of the day.

japanese: １日に何便有りますか。
english: How many cruises are there each day?

japanese: １日に３度１錠ずつ服用してください。
english: Please be sure to take one dose three times a day.

japanese: １日に３回、この薬を服用しなさい。
english: Take the medicine three times a day.

japanese: １日に２０マイル歩く。
english: I cover twenty miles a day.

japanese: １日でローマを見て回るのは不可能に近い。
english: It is next to impossible to see Rome in a day.

japanese: １日コースがありますか。
english: Do you have any day tours?

japanese: １日ではたべきれないほどのリンゴがある。
english: We have more apples than we could eat in a day.

japanese: １日が終わると背中が疲れ、足が痛みました。
english: At the end of every day, his back was tired and his legs hurt.

japanese: １日おきに買い物に行く。
english: I go shopping every other day.

japanese: １日３回必ず薬を服用する。
english: Be sure to take medicine three times a day.

japanese: １日３回間違いなく薬を飲むように。
english: Be sure to take medicine three times a day.

japanese: １頭の象がそこで狩られた。
english: An elephant was hunted there.

japanese: １日１ドルでアメリカで暮らしていけると思いますか。
english: Do you think you can live on a dollar a day in America?

japanese: １等賞を得たのはジャネットだった。
english: It was Janet that won first prize.

japanese: ジャネットが一等を獲った。
english: It was Janet that won first prize.

japanese: １頭の怪物が山の頂上の近くの岩に横になっていた。
english: A monster lay on a rock near the top of the mountain.

japanese: １等賞を取ったぞ。
english: I've won first prize!

japanese: １等をとれるなんて彼女は夢にも思わなかった。
english: Little did she dream that she could win first prize.

japanese: １等になるなんて夢にも思わなかった。
english: Never did I dream of winning first prize.

japanese: １度や２度の失敗はだれにでもある。
english: Everybody fails once or twice.

japanese: １度だけチャンスが残っている。
english: There is but one chance left.

japanese: １台買わなければならない。
english: I must buy one.

japanese: １台の車が入り口に止まった。
english: A car stopped at the entrance.

japanese: １台のトラックが道路を疾走していた。
english: A truck was careering along the road.

japanese: １組の手袋が、タクシーの中に忘れてあった。
english: A pair of gloves was left in the taxi.

japanese: １銭たりともむだにしないのが彼の信条だ。
english: He makes a religion of never wasting a penny.

japanese: １千万円あればその計画には十分だろう。
english: Ten million yen will be ample for the project.

japanese: １世紀は１００年です。
english: A century is one hundred years.

japanese: １人少年が両手をポケットにつっこんで歩いていた。
english: A boy was walking with his hands in his pockets.

japanese: １人は福岡に住んでいて、残りは新潟に住んでいます。
english: One lives in Fukuoka, and the others live in Niigata.

japanese: １人は日本人で、もう１人はイタリア人です。
english: One is Japanese and the other is Italian.

japanese: １人は熊本に、もう１人は東京にいます。
english: One is in Kumamoto and the other in Tokyo.

japanese: １人の老婆が不自由な足で通りを歩いていた。
english: An old woman limped along the street.

japanese: １人の年老いた女性が私たちに城の中を案内してくれた。
english: An old lady guided us through the castle.

japanese: １人の男が私に手を振っていた。
english: A man stood waving his hand to me.

japanese: １人の男が戸口に現れた。
english: A man appeared at the door.

japanese: １人の生徒がベイスン通りで車にひかれた。
english: A student was run over by a car on Basin Street.

japanese: １人の乗客が気を失ったが、スチュワーデスが彼の意識を回復させた。
english: A passenger fainted, but the stewardess brought him around.

japanese: １人の少年だけが交通事故から一命をとりとめた。
english: Only one little boy survived the traffic accident.

japanese: １人の少女が昨日池で溺れ死んだ。
english: A girl drowned in the pond yesterday.

japanese: １人の醜い男が私の家の戸をたたいた。
english: An ugly man knocked on my door.

japanese: １人の警備員が脚を組んで座っていた。
english: A watchman sat with his legs crossed.
